Status: prototype Symbols

Mathematical symbols and special characters.

User need

I need symbols to be clear, so that I can understand the data.

Context

Mathematical symbols and special characters are used throughout the ONS website in articles, data tables and charts.

We are concerned about balancing readability, accessibility (especially screen readers), and understanding.

Common symbols include:

  • Plus: +
  • Minus: −
  • Equals: =
  • Slash: /
  • Ampersand: &

Prototypes

  • Symbol specimen
  • Feedback from GDS accessibilty group
  • Plus and minus symbols

Examples

  • Migration
  • Crime
  • Regional gross value added
  • Country and regional public sector finances
  • Public Sector Finance
  • UK gross domestic expenditure on research and development

Resources

  • ONS style guide
  • Results of the 2016 GOV.UK assistive technology survey
